payload.description: A blazing fast & offline frontend playground

issue.title: Detatched Preview is referencing non-existent style.css file, detached preview iframe is only 300px x 150px
issue.body:
## Meta info

- Bug
- Version 5.10
- Context - Web app

It looks like the `preview.html` should probably be referencing the bundled css file? Either that, or we just need to deploy the `src/style.css` file? If you look at the [preview.html](view-source:https://webmaker.app/app/preview.html) on the production site, we see:
```html
<link rel="stylesheet" href="style.css">
<body>
	<iframe src="about://blank" frameborder="0" id="demo-frame" allowfullscreen></iframe>
	<script src="detached-window.js"></script>
</body>
```
But the main app [index.html](view-source:https://webmaker.app/app/) has:
```html
<html>
  <!-- ... -->
  <head>
    <!-- ... -->
    <link href="./bundle.eef2b.css" rel="stylesheet">
  </head>
  <!-- ... -->
</html>
```

The result is that the embedded iframe in the detached preview is only 300px by 150px, not filling the preview window.  

The reference to `style.css` produces a 404 error, since there is no `/app/style.css` file on the production site. Perhaps the `src/style.css` file should be deployed? It looks like `gulpfile.js` used to include it in the deliverables, but then it got [commented out](https://github.com/chinchang/web-maker/blame/master/gulpfile.js#L90).

@chinchang : Your thoughts?

comment.body: @nhogle Also, one thing I am curious about - do you use web app or chrome extension?

issue.title: Detatched Preview is referencing non-existent style.css file, detached preview iframe is only 300px x 150px
issue.body:
## Meta info

- Bug
- Version 5.10
- Context - Web app

It looks like the `preview.html` should probably be referencing the bundled css file? Either that, or we just need to deploy the `src/style.css` file? If you look at the [preview.html](view-source:https://webmaker.app/app/preview.html) on the production site, we see:
```html
<link rel="stylesheet" href="style.css">
<body>
	<iframe src="about://blank" frameborder="0" id="demo-frame" allowfullscreen></iframe>
	<script src="detached-window.js"></script>
</body>
```
But the main app [index.html](view-source:https://webmaker.app/app/) has:
```html
<html>
  <!-- ... -->
  <head>
    <!-- ... -->
    <link href="./bundle.eef2b.css" rel="stylesheet">
  </head>
  <!-- ... -->
</html>
```

The result is that the embedded iframe in the detached preview is only 300px by 150px, not filling the preview window.  

The reference to `style.css` produces a 404 error, since there is no `/app/style.css` file on the production site. Perhaps the `src/style.css` file should be deployed? It looks like `gulpfile.js` used to include it in the deliverables, but then it got [commented out](https://github.com/chinchang/web-maker/blame/master/gulpfile.js#L90).

@chinchang : Your thoughts?

comment.body:
This is fixed now. Thanks for reporting, Nick!
The style.css wasn't actually necessary...was working before last release because of a cache. Last release removed the file and hence broke the preview. The required styles are now inlined.

issue.title: Detatched Preview is referencing non-existent style.css file, detached preview iframe is only 300px x 150px
issue.body:
## Meta info

- Bug
- Version 5.10
- Context - Web app, Chrome extension or both?:

It looks like the `preview.html` should probably be referencing the bundled css file? If you look at the preview.html on the production site, we see:
```html
<link rel="stylesheet" href="style.css">
<body>
	<iframe src="about://blank" frameborder="0" id="demo-frame" allowfullscreen></iframe>
	<script src="detached-window.js"></script>
</body>
```
But the main app has:
```html
<html>
  <!-- ... -->
  <head>
    <!-- ... -->
    <link href="./bundle.eef2b.css" rel="stylesheet">
  </head>
  <!-- ... -->
</html>
```

The result is that the embedded iframe in the detached preview is only 300px by 150px, not filling the preview window.  

The reference to `style.css` produces a 404 error, since there is no `/app/style.css` file on the production site. Perhaps the `src/style.css` file should be deployed? It looks like `gulpfile.js` used to include it in the deliverables, but then it got [commented out](https://github.com/chinchang/web-maker/blame/master/gulpfile.js#L90).

@chinchang : Your thoughts?

issue.title: self hosted pre hallo world
issue.body: Great work! How can I already fill in some data in a self-hosted variant? My students should already see and edit a "Hello world" and a bit of css.

comment.body: Hey @Mediendozent , you can  "save" a pre-written hello world code and then use the "open" option in top right to share it with your students.

issue.body: I just need look some logs，please remember my choice

comment.body: This is live now. Console state is preserved.

issue.title: Fix showErrors() method of CodeEditor component
issue.body:
- This was causing WebMaker to throw the following error whenever the showErrors() method was called, preventing the desired behavior of showing the errors in the CodeMirror gutter:

	Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'instance')

**Note**: The only relevant changes are lines 190, 191.  The remaining changes were automatically performed by the git pre-commit hook.

comment.body:
Truly mind-blowing, of course. Thanks for all your work here! 🙇
Your fixes are marked in the hall of fame of Web Maker, forever! :)
![image](https://github.com/chinchang/web-maker/assets/379918/2b117914-4986-489a-a3b8-31c29876bac2)

issue.title: Fix showErrors() method of CodeEditor component
issue.body:
- This was causing WebMaker to throw the following error whenever the showErrors() method was called, preventing the desired behavior of showing the errors in the CodeMirror gutter:

	Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'instance')

**Note**: The only relevant changes are lines 190, 191.  The remaining changes were automatically performed by the git pre-commit hook.

issue.title: Code syntax errors not appearing in CodeMirror gutter
issue.body:
## Meta info

- bug
- Version: Web Maker 5.0.3
- Context: Web app (and probably extension too, but I haven't tried)
- Chrome Version: 116.0.5845.188

There is a bug in the code for handling syntax errors when in CodeMirror mode, which prevents the `showErrors()` method of the `CodeEditor` component from showing syntax errors in the gutters.

I will submit a PR to fix this issue.

commits.message: retain console open state on refreshes. fixes #435

issue.title: Fixed issue #95.
issue.body:
Now loops with popup functions (alert, prompt, confirm) like this:
`for (var i = 0; i < 6; i++){alert(i);}`
Will work.
It also works with loops without curly braces, nested loops, and popups called through the window object (e.g. window.alert()).

comment.body: @PythonCow I had the comment written in 2017, but damn this Github UI, they were in "pending" state till today. Sorry!

comment.body:
Possible solution:

- Just before alert statement we record time in a variable.
- After alert, we subtract the time taken by alert from the loop timer variable `_wmloopvar`.
That way time taken by alert statement won't ever be counted in the loop's timer.

comment.body: @PythonCow this is basically resetting the loop timer after the alert statement. This means if there is a real infinite loop that has alert statements in it, it would run forever because of this reset. Right?
